channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Phoenix Airport Grounds Flights After Dust Storms
item.description: The brief ground stop at Sky Harbor International Airport was lifted on Monday evening, but delays were expected as operations resumed.

item.title: Trump says U.S. has much bigger leverage over China on magnets
item.description: “We have much bigger and better cards than they do,” Trump said. “If I played those cards, that would destroy China. I’m not going to play those cards...

item.title: Australia Accuses Iran of Directing Antisemitic Arson Attacks
item.description: The government abruptly severed diplomatic ties and ejected Iran’s ambassador, saying the country had orchestrated attacks in Sydney and Melbourne las...

item.title: Trump declares war on the Fed, setting up a titanic struggle for world’s most important central bank
item.description: “President Trump purported to fire me ‘for cause’ when no cause exists under the law, and he has no authority to do so,” Cook said.

item.title: Lisa Cook Says She Will Not Step Down From the Fed
item.description: Ms. Cook said that she would not resign from the board of governors, hours after President Trump announced he was firing her.

item.title: 4 A.M. at a Beijing Labor Market: Jobs, and Hope, Are in Short Supply
item.description: China’s economic slowdown has fallen especially hard on older migrant workers, who often don’t have the technical skills that employers are seeking.

item.title: Expecting on the Front Lines: Motherhood in Ukraine’s Military
item.description: Pregnant Ukrainian soldiers say they are fighting for the future of their country and for their children.

item.title: Australia Accuses Iran of Directing Antisemitic Arson Attacks
item.description: The government expelled Iran’s diplomats, saying the country was behind the attacks on a Melbourne synagogue and a Sydney restaurant last year.

item.title: 4 A.M. at a Beijing Labor Market: Jobs, and Hope, Are in Short Supply
item.description: China’s economic slowdown has fallen especially hard on older migrant workers, who often don’t have the technical skills that employers are seeking.

item.title: Brazil, India and Other Countries Fight Back Against Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: Brazil, India and other emerging countries are hedging their bets against the United States.

item.title: Tuesday Briefing: Israeli Strikes Killed Five Journalists
item.description: Also, a knockoff Starbucks in North Korea.

item.title: Police Officers Descend on Australian Town After Reports of Fatal Shooting
item.description: The national broadcaster reported that at least two police officers had been killed in a rural town north of Melbourne. The police declined to comment...

item.title: Musk sues Apple and OpenAI, accusing them of being ‘monopolists’ in AI space
item.description: The complaint portrays Apple as a company that views AI as an “existential threat” to its future success, prompting it to collude with OpenAI.

item.title: Southwest Airlines is going to start charging heavy flyers for an extra seat if they can’t fit within armrests
item.description: Currently, plus-size passengers can either pay for an extra seat in advance or they can request a free extra seat at the airport.

item.title: Epstein’s estate subpoenaed by House Oversight Committee
item.description: It's the latest effort by both Republicans and Democrats to respond to public clamor for more disclosure in the investigation into Epstein.
